intro: Lepidaploa canescens, commonly known as the silky lepidaploa, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy, silver-green foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Lepidaploa canescens is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
